job_purpose: To work with and complement the technical engineering staff by utilizing hydrologic and hydraulic modeling tools within a software context.
job_duties_and_responsibilities: Consult with technical and administrative staff to evaluate current workflows and identify limitations and deficiencies in existing systems
Recommend potential software purchases and upgrades, providing advice on researching alternatives
Develop innovative software, applications, tools, and scripts to improve workflow efficiency for projects related to flooding, drainage, and water quality
Prepare written end-user documentation and operational procedures for new and existing tools
Improve flood information processing, integration with GIS platforms, visualization, and analysis
Assist with installing and testing new software and updates
Use programming and coding skills to enhance operational procedures by developing new tools and improving existing scripts
Communicate effectively with both technical and administrative staff
required_qualifications: Experience in software development within an engineering context
Knowledge of hydrologic and hydraulic modeling tools
Ability to develop software, applications, tools, and scripts
preferred_qualifications: Previous experience in improving operational procedures
Experience in technical and administrative communication
company_details: WMS Engineering is a specialist consultancy providing high-quality solutions to civil, water, and environmental problems nationwide. With a mission to deliver reliable engineering solutions through open communication and timely project completion, WMS offers a close-knit team environment where employees can have a significant impact on both business and project operations.
